page.title: 08Ecology
page.content: Conservation a)Bird sanctuary Piling sands noted for hares and six spon burner moth a well as herons, shelducks, godwits and sanderlings.There are many other wild- and water-fowl as well. b)Fylde Conservation Society document plant and animal species present in this area. c)Drainage of marsh area and building of sea wall has made more land available to agricultural uses and building developments. d)Dykes and ponds prolific. e)Tree planting program in area. f)Air pollution fairly low.Wide variety of lichens found growing in the area. g)Noise pollution low. h)Pollution of beach raw sewage, deposits of oil,plastic containers,etc are very common.
